page.title: 07Education in Canterbury (2)
page.content: As it takes many pupils from outside Canterbury, the Catholic Church implemented their comprehensive plans. Every child of{school}age is to be examined at intervals by a school doctor, including dental inspections. A mid-day{meal}is provided at school costing 60p. Many children, however, bring their own packed lunch. Children with special needs are catered for and, where possible, educated in normal schools with the help of a{welfare}assistant. There are opportunities for further education at the{College}of Technology, College of Art, and Christ Church Training College. The King's School, the oldest school in England, was established c.598. It is a public school taking some 700 pupils.
